DEPARTMENT OF STATE AGENCY FOR INTERNATIONAL DEVELOPMENT UNITED STATES AID MISSION TO CHINA
MC- 4173 MEMORANDUM JUN 22 1962
TO
: Mr. C. C. Chang, Chief, Second Division, CUSA
FROM
: H. T. Potter, Supply Advisor, US AID/c
8
SUBJECT: Excess Property, Project Y-99-AX
Reference is made to your Memos No. C2-62-1718 dated June 1, 1962 and No. C2-62-1805 dated June 12, 1962.
In the above memos you have indicated that one crane shovel basic unit (GSA Control No. 7-62-1160) and one shovel front (GSA Control No. 7-62-1129) be assigned to both Keelung Harbor Bureau and the Shihmen Development Commission. We have been advised that the shovel front is available and is frozen for US AID/C. GSA have also offered one crane shovel basic unit (GSA Control No. 7-62-1159) published in the same listing to substitute for the one appearing on GSA No. 7-62-1160 which is not available.
We are forwarding our purchase order for these items, however, we must call your attention to the fact that only one basic unit and shovel front is available. Presumably disposition will be made upon arrival of the equipment in Taiwan.
A copy of Excess Property Bulletin No. 6-62 is attached for your reference and use.
Encl. As stated
LE-16.13.2
2
國史饭 Academia Historica

paragraphs.content: DEPARTMENT OF STATE AGENCY FOR INTERNATIONAL DEVELOPMENT UNITED STATES AID MISSION TO CHINA
: Mr. C. C. Chang, Chief, Second Division, CUSA
: H. T. Potter, Supply Advisor, US AID/c
Reference is made to your Memos No. C2-62-1718 dated June 1, 1962 and No. C2-62-1805 dated June 12, 1962.

In the above memos you have indicated that one crane shovel basic unit (GSA Control No. 7-62-1160) and one shovel front (GSA Control No. 7-62-1129) be assigned to both Keelung Harbor Bureau and the Shihmen Development Commission. We have been advised that the shovel front is available and is frozen for US AID/C. GSA have also offered one crane shovel basic unit (GSA Control No. 7-62-1159) published in the same listing to substitute for the one appearing on GSA No. 7-62-1160 which is not available.

We are forwarding our purchase order for these items, however, we must call your attention to the fact that only one basic unit and shovel front is available. Presumably disposition will be made upon arrival of the equipment in Taiwan.
A copy of Excess Property Bulletin No. 6-62 is attached for your reference and use.
